Key Match Events: Son Heung-min scored a brace and assisted one goal to help South Korea beat China 3-0.
South Korea showed dominance with 65 percent of ball possession and a total of 18 shots.
South Korea broke the deadlock just 11 minutes into the match with a penalty converted by Son Heung-min.
Son Heung-min headed home his second goal from a corner in the 45th minute.
Jung Seung-hyun's header sealed the 3-0 victory for South Korea in the 86th minute.
Miscellaneous Highlights: In the other Group C match on Tuesday, Thailand secured an away victory over Singapore 3-1.

In the second stage of the Asian qualifying tournament, 36 teams have been divided into nine groups competing in a home-and-away round-robin format. The top two of each group will advance to the third stage.
